review: So far I love it! I really only use it for Netflix, Hulu, Pandora, and YouTube (because the other apps require subscriptions or whatever), but so far it has been great. I didn't want to shell out a ton of money for the AppleTV, plus my boyfriend has it, and while it is great and I am a avid Apple fan, this tiny thing does what I need it to do, at half the price.
author: Corrie

review: We used the Amazon Fire TV stick on a recent trip and it was brilliant. Plug it in, get it set up with the hotel wireless, and go!We'd tried the Roku stick first, but it couldn't handle the hotel wireless system (which required that you click "agree" to gain access). Fire TV had no problem with that at all. It was easy as pie to get it up and running.My only complaint is that the Fire TV Stick doesn't get as good of wireless reception as the larger (puck-sized) streaming devices.Otherwise, though, it's the perfect media player while on the road.
